alert.note: Alert for Alamance; Chatham; Guilford; Randolph (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 09 at 1:42PM EDT until July 09 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Raleigh
info.description: ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON FOR ALAMANCE, NORTHWESTERN CHATHAM, GUILFORD AND NORTHEASTERN RANDOLPH COUNTIES... At 142 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated ongoing light rain where thunderstorms produced heavy rain. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses. Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Greensboro, High Point, Burlington, Graham, Randleman, Siler City, Mebane, Elon, McLeansville, Archdale, Summerfield, Gibsonville, Pleasant Garden, Jamestown, Liberty, Haw River, Ramseur, Franklinville, Swepsonville and Alamance. This includes the following streams and drainages... Lick Creek, Cane Creek, Brush Creek, North Buffalo Creek, Muddy Creek, Reedy Fork, Horsepen Creek, East Fork Deep River, and Buffalo Creek FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Move to higher ground now. Act quickly to protect your life. Flooding is occurring or is imminent. It is important to know where you are relative to streams, rivers, or creeks which can become killers in heavy rains. Campers and hikers should avoid streams or creeks.
